intro: Tibouchina anderssonii, commonly known as the Brazilian violet or purple flame, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a waxy texture. Tibouchina anderssonii thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
